simsim.core
Class Multicasting

java.lang.Object
  simsim.core.Multicasting

public class Multicasting
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides basic functionality for joining, leaving and sending messages to groups of nodes. Groups are identified by an object name, usually a string. They are created on demand by the act of joining or requesting its endpoint. Joining a group is only needed for receiving messages addressed to the group.

Author:
SÃ©rgio Duarte (smd@di.fct.unl.pt)

Multicasting

public Multicasting()
Method Detail

endpoint

public static EndPoint endpoint(java.lang.Object group)
Returns a endpoint that can be used to send multicast messages to a group of nodes. If the group does not yet exist it is created.

Parameters:
group - - the name of the group, usually a string.
Returns:
the endpoint associated with the multicast group.

joinGroup

public static EndPoint joinGroup(java.lang.Object group,
                                 EndPoint e)
Allows a node to join a group and receive messages via the handler associated with an endpoint. If the group does not yet exist it is created.

Parameters:
group - - the name of the group, usually a string.
e - - the endpoint that will be used to deliver messages to the node.
Returns:
Returns the endpoint of the multicast group, which can be used to send messages to the group.

leaveGroup

public static void leaveGroup(java.lang.Object group,
                              EndPoint e)
Allows a node to remove itself from a multicast group.

Parameters:
group - - the name of the group, usually a string.
e - - the endpoint that had joined the group.
